lead_paragraph: SLATER--Marylin June. Born February 7, 1937. Died February 21, 2016 after a brief battle with ovarian cancer. Marylin was a special woman. An ESL (English as a Second Language) teacher in Port Washington from the late 1970s to the early 90's, she made meaningful differences in hundreds of students' lives. She moved to the Upper West Side in the 1990s where she continued teaching as a tutor. She enjoyed family, travel, exotic dining, art, music, and theatre. She was also an advocate of the underdog. She is survived by her children, Daniel (Rachel), Zachary (Nancy), and Vivian Votava (Mark), as well as by her grandchildren Jacob, Erich, Samantha, Evan, Leah and Gabe. She is survived by her adoptive children, Le Thu Nguyen, Joseph Arenas, Alex Silva, Fran Aryani, and families. She has donated her body to medicine so as to continue teaching after passing. In lieu of flowers, a donation can be made to the JD Blumenfeld Scholarship Fund (benefits ESL grads), at PO Box 386, Port Washington, NY 11050 or the Ovarian Cancer Research Fund, ocrf.org. A celebration of her life is planned for April 10th, 3pm at the Rubin Museum, 150 W. 17th St., NY, NY. 1/3
